description: On 1 May 2024, at the call of DGB, around 150 people, including SPD members, Ver.di and the women educational association 'Sofia', participated in a cycling and walking protest in Wolfratshausen (Bayern) calling for among other things emergency financial aid for hospitals from the federal government, a reduction in working hours with full wage compensation and comprehensive co-determination rights for employees, commemorating the forced laborers and refugees in the former Fohrenwald camp and denouncing the widening gap between rich and poor. The protest was organized in the context of the Labor Day.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Government of Germany (2021-); IGM: Industrial Union of Metalworkers; Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 30 April 2024, at the call of IGM, significantly more than 10,000 people, including Thyssenkrupp steel workers, Federal Minister of Labor (SPD), State Minister of Labor (CDU), President of the Bundestag (SPD), the mayor (SPD) and SPD members of the state parliament, participated in a protest in Duisburg (Nordrhein-Westfalen) against job cuts and sales plans and demanded concrete concepts, plans and location guarantees.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Government of Germany (2021-); The Greens (Germany)
description: On 30 April 2024, people, including City council members of the Greens and the CDU, participated in a protest in Mauerpark in Berlin - Pankow (Berlin) calling for sound insulation and for the preservation of the green area for barbecues and playing music.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Students (Germany); The Greens (Germany); The Left (Germany)
description: On 29 April 2024, under the motto 'The Monday exists for Diversity' and at the call of several socio-cultural actors and the 'Alliance Clear Edge' (Bundnis Klare Kante), around 350 people, including the Left, CDU, the Greens, the Voters' Alliance 'Citizens for Gorlitz' (Burger fur Gorlitz, the working council 'Gorlitz Sustainable' (Gorlitz Anchali), 'Meetingpoint Memory Messiaen', 'A-Team', 'Ostritz' Peace Festival' (Ostritzer Friedensfest), 'Basta-Club' and the student club 'Mouse' (Maus), participated in a counter-protest in Gorlitz (Sachsen) for diversity and against the ongoing Monday demonstration. At the same time, around 260 people participated in the Monday demonstration without detailing the motives of the protest.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Government of Germany (2021-); Israeli Group (Germany); Jewish Group (Germany); Students (Germany); The Greens (Germany); Women (Germany)
description: On 28 April 2024, under the motto 'Run for their lives' and 'Let our people go' and at the call of the Jewish Community, between 250 and 300 people, including two mayors (CDU), the 'Jewish Student Association NRW' (Judischer Studierendenverband NRW), the women's association 'WIZO', the association 'Kehilat NRW - Israeli Culture and Integration Association' (Israelischer Kultur und Integrationsverein Nordrhein-Westfalen e. V) and the state's Economics Minister (The Greens), participated in a protest in Dusseldorf (Nordrhein-Westfalen) calling for the release of Hamas' hostages and for solidarity with Israel.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); Grannies Against the Right (Germany); Independent Politicians (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; Women (Germany)
description: On 27 April 2024, at the call of 'Initiative for Democracy' (Initiative fur Demokratie), more than 200 people, including the mayor (Independent), Grannies Against the Right, a member of the youth parliament and a State Council member (SPD), participated in a protest in Gehrden (Niedersachsen) against right-wing extremism, the AfD, hatred, xenophobia and agitation and for tolerance, diversity, democracy and solidarity.

organizers: Catholic Christian Group (Germany); FW: Free Voters; Government of Germany (2021-); Grannies Against the Right (Germany); KFD: Catholic Women Association Germany; SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany); Ukrainian Group (Germany); Women (Germany)
description: On 27 April 2024, under the mottos 'Sinsheim is colorful' and '75 Years Basic Law' and at the call of 'Alliance for Tolerance' (Bundnis fur Toleranz), between 400 and 500 people, including 40 associations, organizations, politicians, candidates for the local elections (FW, the Greens), Bundestag Members (The Greens, SPD), the deputy Chairman of the German-Ukrainian Society Rhine-Neckar (Deutsch-Ukrainische Gesellschaft Rhein-Neckar), Catholics, Grannies Against the Right and the Chairwoman of the Steinfurt KFD, participated in a protest in Sinsheim (Baden-Wurttemberg) for the Basic Law and against right-wing extremism, racism.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Christian Group (Germany); Former Government of Germany (2021-); Government of Germany (2021-); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 27 April 2024, around 400 people, including the former mayor (SPD), several associations and parties, representatives of the church, the local mayor (SPD), a member of the State Parliament (CDU) and the municipality mayor (SPD), participated in a protest in Ochtendung (Rheinland-Pfalz) against right-wing extremism, anti-Semitism, the AfD and xenophobia and for democracy, diversity and acceptance of other cultures and religions. The participants also called on people to vote in the upcoming local and EU elections.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; FDP: Free Democratic Party; FW: Free Voters; Grannies Against the Right (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; Women (Germany)
description: On 21 April 2024, at the call of the CDU, SPD, FW, FDP, Grannies Against the Right, 'Friendship Circle for Refuge and Asylum' (Freundeskreis Flucht und Asyl), and 'Family Forum in the Multigenerational House' (Familienforum im Mehrgenerationenhaus (MGH)), hundreds of people gathered in Markdorf (Baden-Wurttemberg), to protest against right-wing ideologies.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; DIG: German-Israeli Society; Government of Germany (2021-); Israeli Group (Germany); Jewish Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 16 April 2024, under the motto 'Hands off Israel! Together against the terror of the Islamic regime' and at the call of the 'Young Forum Saar' (Junges Forum Saar) and DIG, around 120 people, including the chairwoman of the 'Saar Synagogue Community' (Synagogengemeinde Saar), Minister President Anke Rehlinger (SPD), the state government's anti-Semitism commissioner, a number of state and local politicians and the mayor (CDU), participated in a protest in front of the synagogue in Saarbrucken (Saarland) in solidarity with Israel in the context of Iran's recent missile attacks.

organizers: Grannies Against the Right (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Left (Germany); Women (Germany)
description: On 16 April 2024, under the motto 'Moving Freiburg to the center', about 260 people, including representatives of the Left, SPD and Grannies Against the Right, participated in a protest in Freiburg im Breisgau (Baden-Wurttemberg) against the AfD's district association election campaign kick-off in the Burgerhaus Zahringen.

organizers: AfD: Alternative for Germany; CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; FDP: Free Democratic Party; Independent Politicians (Germany); The Left (Germany)
description: Around 15 April 2024 (as reported), about 50 people, including the candidates for the district council election (The Left, CDU, FDP, AfD, Independent), participated in a protest in Sulza (Thuringen) for two district roads in Saale-Holzland and better bus connections.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany)
description: Around 15 April 2024 (as reported), around 70 people, including the mayor (SPD) and a member of the Greens, participated in a protest in Hartlingen (Rheinland-Pfalz) for democracy, peace and freedom and against right-wing extremism. The protest was organized following reports about a secret meeting between AfD members and far-right activists in Potsdam in November 2023, during which remigration plans were discussed.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; DIG: German-Israeli Society; Government of Germany (2021-); Israeli Group (Germany)
description: On 14 April 2024, under the motto 'Hands off Israel - against the Islamic missile terror of the Iranian regime' and at the call of the Young Forum of the DIG, around 100 people, including a city council member (CDU), participated in a protest in Leipzig (Sachsen) in solidarity with Israel and against Iran's direct attack on Israel. The participants also called for more solidarity with the protest movement in Iran.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; DIG: German-Israeli Society; Government of Germany (2021-); Israeli Group (Germany); The Greens (Germany)
description: On 14 April 2024, under the motto 'Hands off Israel' and at the call of DIG, about 500 people, including a member of the Bundestag (the Greens) and the mayor (CDU), participated in a protest on Pariser Platz in Berlin - Mitte (Berlin) in solidarity with Israel and against anti-Semitism and the Iranian attack on Israel.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Government of Germany (2021-); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 14 April 2024, around 300 people, including the mayor (CDU) and a state council member (SPD), participated in a protest in Mechernich (Nordrhein-Westfalen) against right-wing extremism and racism. The protest was organized following reports about a secret meeting between AfD members and far-right activists in Potsdam in November 2023, during which remigration plans were discussed.

organizers: Alliance Against the Right; OEDP: Ecological Democratic Party; PP: Pirate Party (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; Volt Europa
description: On 14 April 2024, at the call of Volt Europa, around 200 people, including SPD, OEDP, PP and the Alliance Against the Right, participated in a protest in Nurnberg (Bayern) to commemorate the Nurnberg trials and to demonstrate against right-wing extremism, the AfD, populism and for democracy.

organizers: IGBCE: Industrial Union for Mining, Chemistry and Energy; Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 13 April 2024, under the motto 'Never again is now' and at the call of the 'Alsdorf Alliance for Democracy' (Alsdorfer Bundnis fur Demokratie), around 500 people, including members of the SPD and IGBCE, participated in a protest in Alsdorf (Nordrhein-Westfalen) for democracy, humanity and diversity and against right-wing extremism. The protest was organized following reports about a secret meeting between AfD members and far-right activists in Potsdam in November 2023, during which remigration plans were discussed.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Government of Germany (2021-); The Greens (Germany)
description: On 12 April 2024, around 25 people, including members of the State Parliament (CDU and The Greens), participated in a pro-Israel protest in Berlin - Mitte (Berlin) against anti-Semitism, Hamas, hatred, and division. The protest was organized to denounce the so-called 'Palestine-Congress' taking place on the weekend, which the protesters considered as a way to demonize and delegitimize Israel.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); Grannies Against the Right (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; Students (Germany); Women (Germany)
description: On 12 April 2024, at the call of the association 'Verden is colorful' (Verden ist bunt) and 'Untouchable' (Unantastbar), around 300 people, including students, the mayor (SPD) and Grannies Against the Right, participated in a protest in Verden (Niedersachsen) for democracy and against right-wing extremism and the AfD. The protest was organized following reports about a secret meeting between AfD members and far-right activists in Potsdam in November 2023, during which remigration plans were discussed.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Government of Germany (2021-); Grannies Against the Right (Germany); Women (Germany)
description: On 12 April 2024, around 150 people, including Grannies Against the Right affiliates, members of the 'Citizens' Association Ohe' (Burgerverein Ohe) and the mayor (CDU), participated in a protest in front of the castle in Reinbek (Schleswig-Holstein) against far-right extremism and for democracy, as an AfD event was simultaneously taking place inside the venue. The protest was organized following reports about a secret meeting between AfD members and far-right activists in Potsdam in November 2023, during which remigration plans were discussed.

organizers: SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 8 April 2024, hundreds of people, including activists and SPD affiliates, gathered in Dortmund (Nordrhein-Westfalen) to protest against a proposed industrial area in the Brechten district. Some cited environmental concerns.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); Protestant Christian Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 7 April 2024, at the call of the Alliance against Antisemitism and Antizionis, around 400 to 700 people, including members of the Protestant community, Lower Saxony State Parliament President Hanna Naber (SPD) and Mayor Jurgen Krogmann (SPD), as well as various other politicians from the SPD, gathered in Oldenburg (Niedersachsen) to express their solidarity with the Jewish community following a recent arson attack on a local synagogue. The protest was organized to denounce antisemitism.

organizers: FDP: Free Democratic Party; Government of Germany (2021-); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 7 April 2024, at the call of the Alliance for Democracy and Tolerance, around 150 people, including Member of the Bundestag Jens Brandenburg (FDP) and district board politician Busra Isik (SPD), gathered in Sandhausen (Baden-Wurttemberg) to protest for democracy and tolerance and against right-wing extremism.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Left (Germany)
description: On 7 April 2024, under the motto 'Wesertal is Colorful', around 60 people, including state parliament members Esther Dilcher (SPD) and Jan Kersting (The Left), gathered in Gieselwerder (Hessen) to protest against the presence of around 40 neonazis who had gathered to honor convicted criminal Rudolf Hess on that day.

organizers: Christian Group (Germany); Government of Germany (2021-); Labor Group (Germany); Last Generation (Austria); NGPM: Network of the German Peace Movement; Protesters (Austria); Protesters (Switzerland); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 1 April 2024, under the motto 'Peace Power Europe', around 300 people, including member of the Austrian Last Generation, a Bundestag member (SPD) and representatives of the 'Group for a Switzerland without an Army' (Gruppe fur eine Schweiz ohne Armee), participated in a peace protest in Friedrichshafen (Baden-Wurttemberg) for justice and climate protection and against nuclear weapons. The event was part of the traditional annual Easter peace protests coordinated by the NGPM and supported by 50 initiatives and organizations, including labor unions, political parties, the church (Christian groups), and migration organizations.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany); The Left (Germany)
description: On 1 April 2024, a good 50 people, including a city council member (The Greens), a SPD member, and several members of the Left, protested in Leipzig (Sachsen) to demand a right to intoxication and further legalization of cannabis. The context of the protest was the partial legalization of cannabis on 1 April 2024.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Health Workers (Germany); Labor Group (Germany)
description: On 30 March 2024, around 350 people, including midwives, ambulance drivers, members of the CDU and members of the midwives' association, participated in a protest in Preetz (Schleswig-Holstein) against the closure of the delivery room in the local hospital.

organizers: AI: Amnesty International; Catholic Christian Group (Germany); Christian Group (Germany); Government of Germany (2021-); Labor Group (Germany); NGPM: Network of the German Peace Movement; Pax Christi; SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; Ukrainian Group (Germany)
description: On 30 March 2024, about 2,100 people, including Pax Christi, members of various left-wing and communist parties and labor unions, many Ukrainians, Amnesty International, and a city council member (SPD), participated in a peace protest in Stuttgart (Baden-Wurttemberg) against violence, media's reporting on weapons, and Germany's arms deliveries to Israel. They were also against Russia and wanted to show support for Ukraine. Protesters also called for aid deliveries to people in the occupied territories in Palestine. The event was part of the traditional annual Easter peace protests coordinated by the NGPM and supported by 50 initiatives and organizations, including labor unions, political parties, the church (Christian groups) and migration organizations.

organizers: SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany); The Left (Germany)
description: On 30 March 2024, in the afternoon at the call of 'Alliance for Dialogue and Tolerance' (Bundnis fur Dialog und Toleranz), about 300 people, including a pastor and members of the SPD, The Left and the Greens, participated in a protest in Velten (Brandenburg) against right-wing extremism, exclusion and agitation and for democracy, freedom and the dignity of all.

organizers: Alliance Against the Right; Christian Group (Germany); Government of Germany (2021-); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 30 March 2024, at the call of Alliance Against the Right, 500 people, including the mayor (SPD) and representatives of the church, participated in a protest in Eckernforde (Schleswig-Holstein) against far-right extremism and for diversity, human rights and democracy. The protest was organized following reports about a secret meeting between AfD members and far-right activists in Potsdam in November 2023, during which remigration plans were discussed.

organizers: GJ: Green Youth (Germany); Jusos: Young Socialists in the SPD
description: On 29 March 2024, GJ and Jusos staged a protest in Frankfurt am Main (Hessen) and called for the abolition of the ban on dancing on Good Friday and for the 'freedom of individual decisions and against patronizing and religiously motivated laws'.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 28 March 2024, people, including representatives of labor unions, 'Landliebe - dairy plants' employees and the mayor (SPD), participated in a protest in Heilbronn (Baden-Wurttemberg) against the planned plant closures in Heilbronn and Schefflenz. They also gathered in front of the Kaufland meat plant.

organizers: Aid Workers (Germany); CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Government of Germany (2021-); Health Workers (Germany); ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross; Independent Politicians (Germany); Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany); Ver.di: United Services Union
description: On 28 March 2024, under the motto '48 hours', about 60 people, including employees of the rescue services and the German Red Cross (DRK) as well as Ver.di members, members of the 'Federal Tariff Commission of the DRK', Stuhr's mayor (The Greens), Weyhe's mayor (SPD), Bassum's mayor (Independent), two members of the Bundestag (SPD & CDU) and two members of the State Parliament (SPD & CDU), participated in a protest in Kirchweyhe (Niedersachsen) to raise awareness for their challenging working conditions and call for shorter working hours. The protest was organized in the context of public bargaining negotiations.

organizers: Alliance Against the Right; CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Christian Group (Germany); DGB: German Trade Union Confederation; Government of Germany (2021-); Labor Group (Germany); Protestant Christian Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; Students (Germany); The Greens (Germany)
description: On 28 March 2024, at the call of 'Alliance for Democracy and Tolerance', around 200 people, including representatives of the church, labor unions, the Greens, DGB, the Alliance Against the Right and schools as well as two Bundestag members (SPD, CDU), students and the superintendent of the Protestant church district, participated in a protest in Wetschen (Niedersachsen) for democracy, tolerance, and justice. A group of pro-Palestinian demonstrators walked into the middle of the main demonstration march to express solidarity with Palestine and denounce 'racism' at a demonstration against racism. The main protest was organized following reports about a secret meeting between AfD members and far-right activists in Potsdam in November 2023, during which remigration plans were discussed.

description: On 1 February 2024, at the call of the mayor (independent), private initiatives, and church associations, around 800 people, including councilors (CDU, SPD, the unaffiliated civic list Together for Bebra (Gemeinsam fur Bebra), FW, The Greens), demonstrated from the train station to the town hall in Bebra (Hessen) for democracy, diversity, and against right-wing extremism. Protesters were also against racism, fascism, and discrimination. About 10 men gathered with doves and cowbells for a counter-demonstration. The protest was organized following reports about a secret meeting between AfD members and far-right activists in Potsdam in November 2023, during which remigration plans were discussed.

organizers: Alliance Against the Right; CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Government of Germany (2021-)
description: On 31 January 2024, at the call of the Broad Alliance against the Right (Breiten Bundnis gegen Rechts) and under the motto 'Delmenhorst: Stay colorful!', around 2,000 people, including the town's mayor (CDU), gathered outside the town hall in Delmenhorst (Niedersachsen) to protest against right-wing extremism. The protest was organized following reports about a secret meeting between AfD members and far-right activists in Potsdam in November 2023, during which remigration plans were discussed.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 24 January 2024, at the call of the Citizens' Association for Chemnitz and the Chemnitz Humanity Alliance (Burgerverein fur Chemnitz, and Bundnis Chemnitz fur Menschlichkeit), around 2,100 people, including the city's mayor (SPD), gathered at Neumarkt square in front of the town hall in Chemnitz (Sachsen) against right-wing extremism and the political party AFD. They gathered under the motto 'Chemnitz stands for democracy - Solidarity. Diversity. Humanity'. Demonstrators argued that freedom of expression ended where human dignity was violated and where people incited hatred towards others.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Government of Germany (2021-); Protestant Christian Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 24 January 2024, 5,000 people, including NRW Minister President Hendrik Wust (CDU), superintendent and protestant pastor Joachim Deterding, Member of the State Parliament Stefan Zimkeit (SPD), and mayor Daniel Schranz (CDU), participated in a protest in Oberhausen (Nordrhein-Westfalen) called for by 60 organizations, including 'Round Table against the Right' (Runder Tisch gegen Rechts), within the 'Alliance for Tolerance and Democracy Oberhausen' (Bundnis fur Toleranz und Demokratie Oberhausen) under the motto 'Oberhausen stands up! Against the AfD - Never again is now' against righ-wing extremism, right-wing populism and misanthropy. The protest was part of a nationwide protest movement after recent reports of a secret meeting between AfD members and right-wing extremists in Potsdam past November.

organizers: Farmers (Germany); GJ: Green Youth (Germany); Government of Germany (2021-); Jusos: Young Socialists in the SPD; SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 23 January 2024, about 4,000 people, including farmers, members of the association 'Agriculture connects Bayern' (Landwirtschaft verbindet Bayern), mayor Tobias Eschenbach, District Administrator Helmut Petz and Bundestag Member Andreas Mehltretter (SPD), participated in a protest in Freising (Bayern) called for by GJ and Jusos, against far-right extremism, inhumanity and anti-democractic attitudes. The protest was part of a nationwide protest movement after recent reports of a secret meeting between AfD members and right-wing extremists in Potsdam past November.

organizers: Alliance Against the Right; Catholic Christian Group (Germany); CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; FDP: Free Democratic Party; Labor Group (Germany); Protestant Christian Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany)
description: On 23 January 2024, around 17,000 people, participated in a protest in Darmstadt (Hessen) called for by an alliance of the Greens, CDU, SPD, FDP and the protestant and catholic church under the motto 'For the Rule of Law and Democracy' as well as by several labor unions and the Alliance against the Right under the motto 'Protest against Fascism' for democracy, against right-wing extremism, and against hatred. The protest was part of a nationwide protest movement after recent reports of a secret meeting between AfD members and right-wing extremists in Potsdam past November.

organizers: Alliance Against the Right; AWO: Worker Welfare; CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Labor Group (Germany); Protestant Christian Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany); The Left (Germany)
description: On 23 January 2024, around 3,000 people participated in a protest in Eitorf (Nordrhein-Westfalen) called for by the Alliance Against the Right, consisting of the Greens, SPD, CDU and the Left, supported by other organizations and associations, including Awo and the protestant church, under the motto 'Never Again is Now'. The protest was part of a nationwide protest movement after recent reports of a secret meeting between AfD members and right-wing extremists in Potsdam past November.

organizers: FW: Free Voters; Government of Germany (2021-); PARTEI: The Party; SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany); The Left (Germany)
description: On 20 January 2024, 5,000 to 7,000 people, including the city council leaders from The Greens, SPD, FW, The Left, and Die Partei, staged a protest in Koblenz (Rheinland-Pfalz), advocating against the AfD. The protest was prompted by concerns over a secret meeting between AfD representatives and extremists, discussing mass deportations of individuals with German citizenship and migrant background, leading to a heightened awareness and mobilization against right-wing ideologies in various cities.

organizers: DGB: German Trade Union Confederation; GJ: Green Youth (Germany); Jusos: Young Socialists in the SPD; Labor Group (Germany); Left Youth Solid
description: On 16 January 2024, more than 2,000 people participated in a protest in Wurzburg (Bayern) called for by an alliance of Jusos, GJ, LJ and DGB youth, under the motto 'Never again is now' for a ban of the AfD. The protest occurred in the context of recent reports of a secret meeting between AfD members and right-wing extremists in Potsdam past November.

organizers: FFF: Fridays for Future; Government of Germany (2021-); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; Students (Germany)
description: On 16 January 2024, around 1,600 people, including mayor Rico Badenschier (SPD), participated in a protest in Schwerin (Mecklenburg-Vorpommern) called for by FFF with the support of political parties, trade unions and associations, against the AfD and right-wing extremism. The protest occurred in the context of recent reports of a secret meeting between AfD members and right-wing extremists in Potsdam past November.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Farmers (Germany)
description: On 15 January 2024, around 300 people, including farmers as well as the CDU mayoral candidate, with 35 vehicles protested in Sommerda (Thuringen). The event was part of a nationwide farmers' demonstration movement against planned agricultural subsidy cuts.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); LGBTQ+ (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany); The Left (Germany)
description: On 15 January 2024, between 400 and 500 people participated in a protest in Trier (Rheinland-Pfalz) called for by a broad alliance of SPD, the Greens, the Left and representatives of the LGBTQ+ community, against the AfD and right-wing groups to set a sign for democracy.

organizers: Attac; FFF: Fridays for Future; Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; Students (Germany); The Greens (Germany); The Left (Germany); Ver.di: United Services Union
description: On 15 January 2024, around 1,500 people participated in a protest in Tubingen (Baden-Wurttemberg) called for by FFF and supported by Ver.di, SPD, The Greens, The Left, Attac and various student organizations, under the motto 'Protect Democracy - Tubingen against the Right'. The protest was organized after recent reports about a secret meeting between AfD members and right-wing extremists in Potsdam past November.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Farmers (Germany); Government of Germany (2021-)
description: On 14 January 2024, around 400 people, including Member of the state parliament Winfried Mack (CDU) and Kirchheim's mayor Danyel Atalay, with around 100 tractors participated in a protest in Kirchheim (Hersfeld-Rotenburg, Hessen). The event was part of a nationwide farmers' demonstration movement against planned agricultural subsidy cuts.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Farmers (Germany); Government of Germany (2021-); Labor Group (Germany)
description: Around 14 January 2024 (as reported), around 250 people, including farmers and other entrepreneurs as well as representatives of the State Farmers' Association (Landesbauernverband) and mayor Gunter Buhler (CDU), protested in Bopfingen (Ostalbkreis, Baden-Wurttemberg) with a warning fire. The event was part of a nationwide farmers' demonstration movement against planned agricultural subsidy cuts.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany)
description: On 14 January 2024, around 10,000 people, including mayor Mike Schubert (SPD), Brandenburg's Minister for Culture Manja Schule (SPD), Federal Chancellor Olaf Scholz (SPD) and Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock (The Greens), as well as many families with children and members of the left spectrum, participated in a protest in Potsdam (Brandenburg), called for by the alliance 'Potsdam shows color' (Potsdam bekennt Farbe) to set a sign against far-right ideologies. The protest occurred after recent reports of a secret meeting between AfD members and right-wing extremists in Potsdam past November.

organizers: FFF: Fridays for Future; GJ: Green Youth (Germany); Grannies Against the Right (Germany); Jusos: Young Socialists in the SPD; Students (Germany); The Left (Germany); Women (Germany); XR: Extinction Rebellion
description: On 14 January 2024, 25,000 people, including human rights activists, Left Party Federal Chair Janine Wissler, participated in a protest in Berlin - Mitte (Berlin) called for by 'Joint General Association' (Paritatischer Gesamtverband), Fridays for Future, and numerous other organizations, and supported by Jusos, GJ, Grannies Against the Right, Extinction Rebellion and the association 'Hawwar help' (an association that stands up for a self-determined life in safety for everyone) under the motto 'Defend democracy, stick together' against the shift to the right in Germany and the AfD. The protest occurred in the context of recent reports of a secret meeting between AfD members and right-wing extremists in Potsdam past November.

organizers: FFF: Fridays for Future; GJ: Green Youth (Germany); Jusos: Young Socialists in the SPD; Left Youth Solid; Mission Lifeline; Seebruecke; Students (Germany)
description: On 14 January 2024, between 1,000 and 2,000 people, including many families and children as well as members of 'Dresden Resists' (Dresden Widersetzen), participated in a protest in Dresden (Sachsen) under the motto 'Protect Democracy' (Demokratie verteidigen) against the AfD and racism and to show solidarity with migrantized and racialized people, queer people, Jews, and disabled people. Several alliances, including FFF, Seebruecke, GJ, Jusos, Left Youth Solid, the Student Council of the Technical University in Dresden and Mission Lifeline, had called for the protest after reports about a secret meeting between AfD members and right-wing extremists in Potsdam past November.

organizers: CSU: Christian Social Union in Bavaria; GJ: Green Youth (Germany); Government of Germany (2021-); Jusos: Young Socialists in the SPD
description: On 14 January 2024, around 700 people, including mayor Eva Weber (CSU), participated in a protest in Augsburg (Bayern) called for by Jusos and GJ against the AfD and the party's plans for remigration. The protest was organized after recent reports about a secret meeting between AfD members and right-wing extremists in Potsdam past November.

organizers: DGB: German Trade Union Confederation; FFF: Fridays for Future; GJ: Green Youth (Germany); JL: Young Liberals; JU: Young Union; Jusos: Young Socialists in the SPD; Labor Group (Germany); Left Youth Solid; Students (Germany)
description: On 14 January 2024, about 8,000 people participated in a protest in Saarbrucken (Regionalverband Saarbrucken, Saarland) called for by an alliance of FFF, Jusos, GJ, Linksjugend, JL, JU and GDP under the motto 'Against the Right - For Diversity' against fascism and right-wing agitation. After the rally, people participated in a protest march through the city called for by one of the participants. The protests were organized after recent reports about a secret meeting between AfD members and right-wing extremists in Potsdam past November.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Farmers (Germany); Government of Germany (2021-); Labor Group (Germany)
description: On 13 January 2024, people, including farmers and other entrepreneurs as well as their supporters and Simmerath's mayor Bernd Goffart (CDU), with around 100 vehicles, held a motorcade from Rollesbroich via Kesternich, Konzen via Fringshaus and Lammersdorf, Monschau, to Simmerath (Nordrhein-Westfalen) for a rally. They were against the increase in the truck toll, the increase in the CO2 tax, the abolition of the agricultural diese subsidy, the tax burden on small and medium-sized enterprises, as well as for the reduction of bureaucracy and against the 'shortage of skilled workers in the federal government'.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Farmers (Germany); Government of Germany (2021-); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 13 January 2024, up to 1,000 people, including farmers with around 200 tractors as well as mayor Matthias Moller (non-party), First City Councilor Reinhold Baier (CDU) and Chairman of the City Council Joachim Truss (SPD), participated in a protest in Schluchtern (Main-Kinzig-Kreis, Hessen) with a warning fire to set a sign for their worries and needs as well as their dissatisfaction with current politics. The event was part of a nationwide farmers' demonstration movement against planned agricultural subsidy cuts.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Farmers (Germany); Government of Germany (2021-); Labor Group (Germany)
description: On 13 January 2024, around 200 people including farmers and other entrepreneurs as well as representatives of the Farmers' Association Allgau-Oberschwaben (Bauernverband Allgau-Oberschwaben) and mayor Roland Sauter (CDU) participated in a protest in Argenbuhl (Ravensburg, Baden-Wurttemberg) with a warning fire to express their unsatisfaction with politics. The event was part of a nationwide farmers' demonstration movement against planned agricultural subsidy cuts.

organizers: GJ: Green Youth (Germany); JL: Young Liberals; Jusos: Young Socialists in the SPD
description: On 13 January 2024, about 100 people, including chairman of the 'Association for the Promotion of the Synagogue in Vohl' (Forderverein Synagogue in Vohl) participated in a protest in Frankenberg (Eder) (Waldeck-Frankenberg, Hessen) called for by Jusos, JL and GJ against antisemitism.

organizers: Christian Group (Germany); Government of Germany (2021-); Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany)
description: On 13 January 2024, about 2,400 people, including Bundestag members of the SPD and Greens as well as mayor Soren Link (SPD), participated in a protest in Duisburg (Nordrhein-Westfalen), called for by churches, trade unions and social organizations, against the AfD and to call for a ban of the AfD. The context of the protest is the AfD's New Year's reception taking place in Duisburg at the same time as well as recent reports of a secret meeting between AfD members and right-wing extremists in Potsdam past November.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany)
description: On 13 January 2024, about 650 people, including Bundestag member Sara Nanni (The Greens), member of the Integration Council Hakim El Ghazali (SPD), and Mayor Clara Gerlach (The Greens), participated in a protest in Dusseldorf (Nordrhein-Westfalen) against the AfD and to call for a ban of the AfD. The protest was triggered by reports of a secret meeting between AfD members and right-wing extremists in Potsdam past November.

organizers: Farmers (Germany); Government of Germany (2021-); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 11 January 2024, hundreds of farmers with 500 tractors gathered for a protest in Cottbus (Brandenburg) in front of a hall where Chancellor Olaf Scholz (SPD) was taking part in an event. On the fringes of the event, a discussion between Scholz and Henrik Wendorff, President of the State Farmers' Association, took place. Brandenburg's Minister-President Dietmar Woidke (SPD) and Maja Wallstein (SPD), member of the Bundestag for the Cottbus-Spree-Neisse constituency, also took part in the rally.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Farmers (Germany); Government of Germany (2021-); Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 10 January 2024, 1,700 people, including farmers and craftsmen, with 900 vehicles gathered in Kassel (Hessen), some reaching it as convoys from across the region, to demonstrate. During the rally several speakers, including Member of the Federal Parliament Rimon Gremmels (SPD), President of the Kassel administrative district Mark Weinmeister (CDU), Chairman of the Kassel Regional Farmers' Association Norbert Klapp and Chairman of the Kassel District Farmers' Association Erich Schaumburg, spoke. The event was part of a nationwide farmers' demonstration movement against planned agricultural subsidy cuts.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Government of Germany (2021-); The Greens (Germany)
description: On 6 January 2024, hundreds of people, including representatives from the state government such as Deputy Prime Minister Mona Neubaur (The Greens) and State Chancellery Chief Nathanael Liminski (CDU), staged a protest in Koln (Nordrhein-Westfalen), expressing solidarity and support for the Ukrainian people, carrying a hundred-meter-long Ukrainian flag through the city.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); Health Workers (Germany); Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 11 December 2023, hundreds of people, including elected officials (district councilors), an SPD MP, employees, and health workers, demonstrated in front of the district administration office to Leopoldplatz in Sigmaringen (Baden-Wurttemberg), protesting against a wave of layoffs in the hospital.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Government of Germany (2021-); Jewish Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany)
description: On 10 December 2023, between 3,000 (according to the police) and 11,000 (according to organizers) people, including the mayor of Berlin (CDU), Federal Labor Minister (SPD), officials of The Greens, the Bundestag President (SPD), and a Rabbi, demonstrated from Victory Column to the Brandenburg Gate in Berlin - Mitte (Berlin) against anti-Semitism, hatred, racism, and xenophobia. Protesters called for solidarity and respectful coexistence, as well as a de-correlation between anti-Semitism and anti-Israel sentiments amid the 2023 Israel-Hamas War. They gathered under the motto 'Never again is now, Germany stands up'.

organizers: CDU: Unitary Democratic Coalition; DIG: German-Israeli Society; Government of Germany (2021-); Israeli Group (Germany); JU: Young Union; Students (Germany); The Greens (Germany)
description: On 8 December 2023, at the call of FFI (Fridays for Israel), around 80 people, including members of JU, CDU, an MP (The Greens), DIG, the Jewish community, and students, gathered at the UDK - Universitat der Kunste (University of the Arts) on Hardenbergstrasse in Berlin - Charlottenburg-Wilmersdorf (Berlin) in support of Israel and against anti-Semitism at universities. Protesters chanted 'Free Gaza from Hamas.'

organizers: DIG: German-Israeli Society; Government of Germany (2021-); Israeli Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany)
description: On 7 December 2023, during the evening, at the call of DIG, around 100 people, including the mayor (SPD) and a member of the Landtag of Baden-Wurttemberg (The Greens), gathered on Blarerplatz in Esslingen am Neckar (Baden-Wurttemberg) for a pro-Israel demonstration under the motto 'for the light against the darkness', a political slogan used by the Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu. They condemned Hamas and called statements by Greta Thunberg and Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan anti-Semitic.

organizers: CDU: Unitary Democratic Coalition; Jewish Group (Germany); Students (Germany)
description: On 7 December 2023, around 30 people, including Jewish students and CDU members, gathered at Schneematsch am Platz in Kiel (Schleswig-Holstein) to show solidarity with Israel. They protested against anti-Semitism. They denounced the attack on 7 October 2023 by Hamas and argued that Jewish people's security was at risk.

organizers: DGB: German Trade Union Confederation; Grannies Against the Right (Germany); Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany); The Left (Germany); Women (Germany)
description: On 6 December 2023, almost 50 people, including members of Grannies Against the Right, the Left, SPD, The Greens, and DGB, demonstrated in front of the Maestral restaurant opposite the Reinickendorf town hall in Berlin - Reinickendorf (Berlin) against the far-right political party AFD, which they denounced as 'a fascist, racist, xenophobic and anti-constitutional party whose aim is to destabilize the basic democratic order and divide society.'

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); Health Workers (Germany); Labor Group (Germany); MLPD: Marxist-Leninist Party of Germany; SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; Teachers (Germany); Ver.di: United Services Union
description: On 4 December 2023, people, including employees of universities (teaching and non-teaching), university hospitals (medical and non-medical), fire departments and judiciary courts, as well as members of the MLPD and SPD-affiliated members of the state parliament, participated in a protest in Essen (Nordrhein-Westfalen) called for by Ver.di in the context of current public bargaining negotiations involving federal public sector workers across the country.

organizers: FDP: Free Democratic Party; Muslim Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 3 December 2023, hundreds of people, including members of SPD and FDP, as well as representatives of the 'Zentralrat der Muslime (ZMD)' (Central Council of Muslims), participated in a peace protest in Koln (Nordrhein-Westfalen) called for by the artist initiative 'Arsch huh' under the motto 'Give Peace a Chance!', calling for peace in the Near East. The participants condemned Hamas' attacks and anti-Semitism, but also the Israeli military campaign around the Gaza Strip, and the killing of civilians, while emphasizing Israel's right to exist, as well as that of Palestinians.

organizers: AfD: Alternative for Germany; CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Government of Germany (2021-); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 2 December 2023, around 300 people, including district councilors and members of the state parliament from CDU, AfD and SPD, participated in a protest in Ahlhorn (Oldenburg, Niedersachsen) called for by the 'Burgerverein Ahlhorn' (Citizens' Association Ahlhorn) against a planned, local refugee reception center. The participants emphasized that their protest was not fueled by xenophobic reasons but rather concerns about social cohesion and peace. A counter-protest was organized by 'Aktionsbundnis Landkreis Oldenburg' (Action Alliance County Oldenburg) to show solidarity with refugees.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Left (Germany)
description: On 2 December 2023, around 60 people, including MP Kevin Leiser (SPD) and Silvia Ofori, spokeswoman for the Left Party district association, participated in a protest in Herboldshausen in Kirchberg an der Jagst (Schwabisch Hall, Baden-Wurttemberg) called for by the association 'Ohne Rechtsausen' (Without far right), against the rightwing group 'Bund fur Gotterkenntnis (Ludendorff)' (Covenant for knowledge of God), which held a meeting at a home on that day, and to set a sign against hatred, agitation and extremism.

organizers: BUND: German Federation for the Environment and Nature Conservation; CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Farmers (Germany); Government of Germany (2021-); IGM: Industrial Union of Metalworkers; Labor Group (Germany); NABU: Nature and Biodiversity Conservation Union
description: On 1 December 2023, people, including mayor Kingebiel (CDU), BUND, NABU and the 'Bundnis Salzgitter gegen Konrad' (Alliance Salzgitter against Konrad) (consisting of the city Salzgitter; 'Landvolk' (an association representing the interests of farmers and their families), IGM and the working group 'AG Schacht Konrad' participated in a protest in Salzgitter (Niedersachsen) against the plans for the nuclear waste repository Schacht Konrad as according to them the plans are outdated and important aspects such as long-term safety and retrievability are not taken into account.

organizers: Christian Group (Germany); Government of Germany (2021-); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 18 November 2023, around 300 people, including representatives of the Swabian government, the church and MP Christoph Schmid (SPD), participated in a protest in Wemding (Donau-Ries, Bayern) against a meeting of far-right 'Reichsburger' activists taking place during the weekend and for openness, diversity, the rule of law, and against racism.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); IGM: Industrial Union of Metalworkers; Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 14 November 2023, at the call of IGM, around 300 people, mostly employees from the military aviation industry, and the head of government (SPD), demonstrated in front of the site of Airbus Defense and Space in Bremen (Bremen) against the federal government's decision to increasingly purchase military aircraft and helicopters from the United States.

organizers: DIG: German-Israeli Society; Government of Germany (2021-); Israeli Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 12 November 2023, around 300 people, including DIG members and the mayor (SPD), gathered at the Alten Markt in Potsdam (Brandenburg) to express their solidarity with Israel. They also condemned the actions of Hamas.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Government of Germany (2021-); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; Health Workers (Germany)
description: On 10 November 2023, at the call of local politicians (SPD and CDU), around 200 people, including nursing staff and the mayor (CDU), demonstrated in Merzig (Merzig-Wadern) against the planned reduction from 40 to 20 beds in inpatient psychiatric care in the psychiatric ward at the SHG clinic.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Government of Germany (2021-); Jewish Group (Germany); JU: Young Union; Students (Germany)
description: On 10 November 2023, during the morning, at the call of JU, around 170 people, including MPs (CDU), Jewish students, and politicians, gathered in front of the main building of the Freien Universitat of Berlin (FU) in Berlin - Steglitz-Zehlendorf (Berlin) in solidarity with Israel, against anti-Semitism, and against pro-Palestine demonstrations. They promoted Israel's right to 'self-defense'. Protesters carried Israeli flags and Israeli rainbow flags.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); IGM: Industrial Union of Metalworkers; Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 10 November 2023, at the call of IGM, around 200 people, including an MP (SPD), demonstrated on Jungfernstieg in Hamburg - Hamburg-Mitte (Hamburg) for higher wages, better working conditions, and a collective agreement amid wage negotiations for the public sector of the federal states.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; FDP: Free Democratic Party; Government of Germany (2021-); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany)
description: On 9 November 2023, at the call of CDU, SPD, The Greens, and FDP, around 100 people, including the mayor (CDU), demonstrated in front of the town hall in Sprockhovel (Nordrhein-Westfalen) against anti-Semitism and lack of humanity. Protesters called for solidarity and compassion, while denouncing pro-Palestinian demonstrations as anti-Israeli and denying the country's right to exist. They also commemorated the victims of the Night of Broken Glass (Kristallnacht).

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 9 November 2023, around 300 people, including the mayor (SPD), and youth organizations, gathered at Simon-Cohen-Platz in Castrop-Rauxel (Recklinghausen) for a silent march against forgetting anti-Semitic crimes and the Holocaust. They also commemorated the victims of the Night of Broken Glass (Kristallnacht) and the pogroms of 1938. 2 women (16 and 19-year old) took an Israeli flag from a 56-year-old man during the protest, with which he was taking part in the silent march. They ran off with it.

organizers: CSU: Christian Social Union in Bavaria; FW: Free Voters; Government of Germany (2021-); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany)
description: On 9 November 2023, at the call of Hip ist bunt and councilors, over 50 people, including MPs (CSU, FW), the Greens, and the mayor (SPD), staged a protest on the market square in Hilpoltstein (Bayern, Roth) for peace in the context of the situations in Ukraine and the Middle East. Protesters were against xenophobia, racism, hatred, anti-Semitism. They called for the protection of Jewish life while arguing against an unconditional yes to Israel's policy with regard to the Palestinian civilian population. They also commemorated the victims of the Night of Broken Glass (Kristallnacht) and the pogroms of 1938.

organizers: BUND: German Federation for the Environment and Nature Conservation; DGB: German Trade Union Confederation; Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; Students (Germany); Ver.di: United Services Union
description: On 9 November 2023, at the call of 'Munchen ist bunt!', der Kreisjugendring Munchen-Stadt (Munich City Youth Council), Ver.di, DGB, BUND, and StadtschulerInnenvertretung (the Student Council), around 700 people, including an SPD member, gathered at Odeonsplatz and demonstrated in Munchen (Bayern) against anti-Semitism, hatred, agitation, and far-right groups. They also commemorated the victims of the Night of Broken Glass (Kristallnacht) and the pogroms of 1938.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Evangelical Christian Group (Germany); Government of Germany (2021-); Jewish Group (Germany); Protestant Christian Group (Germany); The Greens (Germany)
description: On 8 November 2023, during the evening, at the call of the Evangelical and Protestant churches, around 3,000 people, including the Jewish community (members of Zentralrats der Juden), and MPs (CDU, The Greens), demonstrated from the former synagogue location on Glockengasse to the current synagogue on Roonstrasse in Koln (Nordrhein-Westfalen) to express solidarity with Israel and the Jewish population with a silent march. They paid tribute to the victims in Israel and denounced the attack by Hamas on 7 October 2023. North Rhine-Westphalia's Prime Minister Hendrik Wust (CDU), Interior Minister Herbert Reul and Media Minister Nathanael Liminski (both CDU) as well as Justice Minister Benjamin Limbach (Greens) were present.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany)
description: On 4 November 2023, about 150 people gathered for a rally in Steinen (Baden-Wurttemberg), protesting against a local convention of the AfD party, as well as against racism. Among them, there was an MP (Green party) and a local SDP representative. Four participants were detained for attempting to block an approaching vehicle of the AfD party.

organizers: Catholic Christian Group (Germany); GJ: Green Youth (Germany); Government of Germany (2021-); Israeli Group (Germany); JL: Young Liberals; JU: Young Union; Jusos: Young Socialists in the SPD; Protestant Christian Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 3 November 2023, people, including mayor Harry Mergel (SPD), members of the German-Israeli-Community and the catholic and protestant church, participated in a protest in Heilbronn (Baden-Wurttemberg) organized by JU, GJ, Jusos and JL under the motto 'Against Anti-Semitisms in the region and everywhere!'. Participants condemned Hamas terror, commemorated those killed and demanded the release of the more than 200 hostages.

organizers: AWO: Worker Welfare; DGB: German Trade Union Confederation; Government of Germany (2021-); Heart Instead of Hate; IGM: Industrial Union of Metalworkers; Jusos: Young Socialists in the SPD; Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany)
description: On 3 November 2023, around 150 people participated in a protest in Osterburken (Neckar-Odenwald-Kreis, Baden-Wurttemberg) organized by an alliance of 'Arbeitskreis fur Toleranz und Vielfalt Osterburken' (Working Group for Tolerance and Diversity Osterburken), Heart Instead of Hate, SPD, Neckarelz concentration camp memorial, 'Netzwerk gegen Rechts Main-Tauber' (Main-Tauber network against right-wing extremism), AWO, Jusos, The Greens, IGM and DGB under the motto 'No Room for the Right' against the AfD and their citizen dialogue taking place simultaneously in the Baulandhalle and to demonstrate for an open, tolerant and philanthropic Osterburken.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; FDP: Free Democratic Party; Jewish Group (Germany); Protestant Christian Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany)
description: On 1 November 2023, a good 150 people, including members of CDU, SPD, The Greens, FDP and BBS (a free non-partisan electoral group in Bad Segeberg), representatives of the Jewish Community and the protestant church, protested in Bad Segeberg (Segeberg, Schleswig-Holstein) in solidarity with Israel after the attacks of Hamas and for peace and tolerance.

organizers: DIG: German-Israeli Society; Government of Germany (2021-); Israeli Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany)
description: On 29 October 2023, at the call of DIG, between 400 (according to the police) and 1,500 (according to organizers) people, including the Federal Minister of Agriculture (The Greens), the Minister of Justice (SPD), demonstrated at Marktplatz in Stuttgart (Baden-Wurttemberg) to show their solidarity with Israel and denounce anti-Semitism. Protesters gathered under the motto 'We stand with Israel'.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Government of Germany (2021-); Israeli Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 29 October 2023, around 200 people, including the Israelitischen Gemeinde Freiburg (Israeli community), the mayor (SPD), and a councilor (CDU), came to the square of the Old Synagogue in Freiburg im Breisgau in solidarity with Israel and for its right to 'defend itself'.

organizers: SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; Thai Group (Germany)
description: On 29 October 2023, at the call of the Thai Association and SPD, around 50 people demonstrated in Berlin - Charlottenburg-Wilmersdorf for the preservation of the Thai market in Preussenpark.

organizers: CSU: Christian Social Union in Bavaria; FDP: Free Democratic Party; Israeli Group (Germany); Jewish Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany); Volt Europa
description: On 29 October 2023, at the call of Linke Bundnis gegen Antisemitismus (The Left Alliance against Anti-Semitism), CSU, FDP, The Greens, SPD, Volt, and a German/Israeli citizen and Jew, around 1,000 people demonstrated at Odeonsplatz in Munchen (Bayern) to show support to the State of Israel, to support Israel's right to self-defense and condemn the Hamas attack on 7 October 2023.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); Protesters (Pakistan); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany)
description: On 28 October 2023, over 200 people, including one woman from Pakistan and MPs (SPD, The Greens), demonstrated in Witten to show solidarity with Israel and the civilian victims in the Gaza Strip, in Palestine. They condemned anti-Semitism and accused Hamas of using civilians as human shields. They also emphasized Palestinians' right to exist and have human rights.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; FDP: Free Democratic Party; FW: Free Voters; GJ: Green Youth (Germany); Grannies Against the Right (Germany); Jusos: Young Socialists in the SPD; PP: Pirate Party (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany); The Left (Germany); Women (Germany)
description: On 27 October 2023, at the call of The Greens and SPD, around 80 people, including members of Jusos, CDU, FDP, The Left, Free Voters, GJ, Pirate Party, Grannies Against the Right, and Hab8cht, demonstrated in the Horrem district around the Socio-Cultural Center in Kerpen against an ongoing AfD rally. They denounced the policies of the far-right political party AfD as inhumane.

organizers: Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; Ver.di: United Services Union
description: On 25 October 2023, around 200 people, including former employees, as well as representatives of Ver.di and the SPD, and the musicians 'Brings-Bruder' and Jens Strifling from 'Hohnern', participated in a protest in front of the building of the Dumont media group in Koln (Nordrhein-Westfalen) to protest against the layoff of 200 employees and 250 temporary workers 3 weeks prior.

organizers: Alevi Muslim Group (Germany); DGB: German Trade Union Confederation; FFF: Fridays for Future; GJ: Green Youth (Germany); Jusos: Young Socialists in the SPD; Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; Students (Germany); The Greens (Germany)
description: On 24 October 2023, around 300 people participated in a protest in Villingen-Schwenningen (Schwarzwald-Baar-Kreis, Baden-Wurttemberg) organized by the Alliance 'VS ist bunt' (Villingen Schwenningen is colorful) consisting of the DGB, SPD, Jusos, The Greens, GJ, as well as the Allevitische Gemeinde Villingen-Schwenningen e.V. (Alevi Community Villingen Schwenningen) and the local group of FFF, under the motto 'No city, no voice, no space for the AfD and right-wing agitation'. The protest was organized in light of a citizens' dialogue of the AfD happening on the same day.

organizers: Catholic Christian Group (Germany); CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; DGB: German Trade Union Confederation; Evangelical Christian Group (Germany); FDP: Free Democratic Party; Government of Germany (2021-); Government of Israel (2022-); Jewish Group (Germany); Labor Group (Germany); Muslim Group (Germany); Protesters (Israel); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany); The Left (Germany)
description: On 22 October 2023, 25,000 (according to the organizers) or 10,000 (according to police) people, including Israeli ambassador, political representatives such as the German President, SPD leader, CDU Secretary General, FDP Secretary General , The Greens Leader and The Left Leader, as well as Berlin's Governing Mayor (CDU), participated in a pro-Israel protest at Brandenburger Tor in Berlin - Mitte (Berlin), organized by a broad civil society alliance, including among others, all democratic parties of the Bundestag, DGB and 'Arbeitgeberverband' (Employer's Association), 'Zentralrat der Juden' (Central Council of Jews), the Evangelical and Catholic Churches and the Muslim organization Alhambra. The protesters showed their solidarity with Israel, called for better protection of Jewish life in Germany, and demanded an end of the violence against Jews.

organizers: FDP: Free Democratic Party; GJ: Green Youth (Germany); Government of Germany (2021-); JL: Young Liberals; JU: Young Union; Jusos: Young Socialists in the SPD
description: On 22 October 2023, around 100 people, including city council member Markus Waidmann (FDP), participated in a protest in Ravensburg (Baden-Wurttemberg) called for by Jusos, GJ, JL and JU to show their support and solidarity with Israel in the war against Hamas.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); PARTEI: The Party; SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany)
description: On 22 October 2023, around 150 people, including Bundestag member Axel Echeverria (SPD) and Council Member Eckhard Hulshoff (Die Partei) as well as the Green's Parliamentary Group Spokeswoman Liane Baumann, joined a protest on Rathausplatz in Witten (Ennepe-Ruhr-Kreis, Nordrhein-Westfalen) organized by the alliance 'Ennepe-Ruhr stellt sich quer' (Ennepe-Ruhr takes a stand) (an alliance against the right) against the AfD and to call for a clearer stand against the right.

organizers: DIG: German-Israeli Society; Grannies Against the Right (Germany); Israeli Group (Germany); Jewish Group (Germany); PARTEI: The Party; SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; Women (Germany)
description: On 21 October 2023, around 220 people, including members of the liberal Jewish community, Grannies Against the Right, and Die Partei and SPD members, joined a protest at Georgsplatz in Hannover (Region Hannover, Niedersachsen) called for by 'Junges Forum Hannover der Deutsch-Israelischen Gesellschaft' (Young Forum Hannover of the German-Israeli Society) in solidarity with Israel. Simultaneously, around 1,000 people, including members of the 'Palastina Initiative' (Palestine Initiative) participated in a protest on Opernplatz in Hannover called for by the Palestinian community. The pro-Palestinian demonstrators clarified that they were neither supporting Hamas nor the Israeli government which 'has been breaking international law for decades', and said that the German support of Israel should not lead to a disenfranchisement of the Palestinians in the Gaza Strip

organizers: GJ: Green Youth (Germany); JL: Young Liberals; JU: Young Union; Jusos: Young Socialists in the SPD
description: On 20 October 2023, around 30 people with two Israeli flags participated in a protest in Zweibrucken (Rheinland-Pfalz), called for by JU, Jusos, GJ and JL, for peace in the Middle East and against Antisemitism.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; DGB: German Trade Union Confederation; Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany)
description: On 18 October 2023, 200 to 300 people, including numerous local politicians and members of the SPD, CDU and The Greens, participated in a protest in Duisburg (Nordrhein-Westfalen) called for by 'Duisburger Bundnis fur Toleranz und Zivilcourage' (Duisburg Alliance for Tolerance and Civil Courage) created by the DGB, to show solidarity with Israel and support Israel's right for self-defense. At the beginning of the demonstration, a representative of the MLPD distributed leaflets with a critical assessment of the recent events in Israel/Palestine and an appeal for solidarity with the Palestinian liberation struggle. The leaflet also read 'Don't give a foothold to the fascist Hamas!' and included statement that the MLPD defends Israel's right to exist and resolutely opposes anti-Semitism, but is 'just as resolute (...) against Israel's aggression'.

organizers: Iranian Group (Germany); JU: Young Union; SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; Women (Germany)
description: On 18 October 2023, 15 people, including Iranian-born living in Germany women-rights activist Mina Ahadi as well as members of the JU and state politicians of the SPD, protested in Oberhausen (Nordrhein-Westfalen) against the planned concert of Iranian rapper Amir Tataloo.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Christian Group (Germany); Government of Germany (2021-)
description: On 18 October 2023, about 100 people, supported by the church community and mayor Alexander Badrow (CDU), protested in Stralsund (Vorpommern-Rugen, Mecklenburg-Vorpommern) to show solidarity with Israel and demonstrate against the attacks by Hamas and for peace in the region.

organizers: CDU: Unitary Democratic Coalition
description: On 16 October 2023, at the call of a CDU member, during the evening, more than 80 people gathered in Leverkusen to express their solidarity with Israel and denounce the attack of Hamas that happened on 7 October 2023. They also denounced anti-Semitism in the city and the theft of the town hall's Israeli flag (twice). Occasionally shouts of 'Palestine' can be heard from close by but no proper counter-demonstration was reported.

organizers: CDU: Unitary Democratic Coalition; DIG: German-Israeli Society; FDP: Free Democratic Party; Government of Germany (2021-); Independent Politicians (Germany); Israeli Group (Germany); PP: Pirate Party (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany); The Left (Germany); Volt Europa
description: On 15 October 2023, at the call of DIG, The Greens, CDU, SPD, FDP, The Left, the mayor (independent), the Fraktion Zukunft, Volt, UWG-Aachen (an independent electoral community with association status), and the Pirate Party, around 100 people demonstrated in front of the town hall in Aachen (Nordrhein-Westfalen, Stadteregion Aachen) to show solidarity with Israel and denounce the attack on Israel by Hamas.

organizers: Alliance Against the Right; CDU: Unitary Democratic Coalition; Government of Germany (2021-); Israeli Group (Germany); Protesters (Iran); Refugees/IDPs (Iran)
description: On 15 October 2023, at the call of Alliance Against the Right, around 90 people, including Iranian refugees, the Israeli community, and the Brandenburg Vice President of the State Parliament (CDU), demonstrated in Falkensee (Havelland) to express their solidarity with Israel, Jewish people around the world, and all other victims of Hamas. They commented that Israel had to win the war.

organizers: Iranian Group (Germany); JL: Young Liberals; JU: Young Union; Jusos: Young Socialists in the SPD; The Greens (Germany)
description: On 15 October 2023, around 250 people, including members of the youth organizations of the Jusos, The Greens, JU, JL, and a group of around 30 exiled Iranians, gathered on Jungfernstieg in Hamburg - Hamburg-Mitte to denounce the attack of the Hamas on 7 October 2023 in Israel. They also were against the Iranian government. Demonstrators called for the closure of the Islamic Center in Hamburg. They also called for a determined fight against anti-Semitism.

organizers: CDU: Unitary Democratic Coalition; FDP: Free Democratic Party; FW: Free Voters; Government of Germany (2021-); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany)
description: On 14 October 2023, around 250 people, city councilors (The Greens, CDU, SPD, Free Voters, FDP) and the mayor (SPD), demonstrated on Munzplatz in Koblenz to show their solidarity with Israel. They denounced the Hamas attack on Israel on 7 October 2023.

organizers: CDU: Unitary Democratic Coalition; Christian Group (Germany); Government of Germany (2021-); Jewish Group (Germany)
description: On 14 October 2023, around 350 people, including the mayor (CDU), gathered on the Scheinerplatz in Siegen to express solidarity with Israel after the attack by Hamas on 7 October 2023. This event was called by several organizations (Gesellschaft fur Christlich-Judische Zusammenarbeit (CJZ), Aktiven Museum Sudwestfalen, Kreisjugendring Siegen-Wittgenstein, and Tacheles - the Netzwerk gegen Antisemitismus).

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany)
description: On 13 October 2023, during the evening, several hundred people, including a senator (SPD) and an MP (The Greens), demonstrated in front of the synagogue in Berlin - Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg to condemn the attack of the Hamas in Israel on 7 October 2023. They wanted to show solidarity with Israel and Berlin's Jews.

organizers: CDU: Unitary Democratic Coalition; Government of Germany (2021-); Jewish Group (Germany); JU: Young Union; Protestant Christian Group (Germany)
description: On 13 October 2023, at the call of the Arbeitsgemeinschaft christlicher Kirchen Ulm/Neu-Ulm, and the 'Ring politischer Jugend Ulm', around 300 people, including the mayor (CDU), a Rabbi, a Protestant bishop, and a member of JU, gathered on Munsterplatz in Ulm in solidarity with Israel. They called on the government to protect Israel and denounced the attack by the Hamas that happened on 7 October 2023.

organizers: Catholic Christian Group (Germany); CSU: Christian Social Union in Bavaria; Government of Germany (2021-); Jewish Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 12 October 2023, at the call of the Jewish community, more than 1,000 people, including the state Prime Minister (CSU), the mayor (SPD), a Cardinal, and a regional bishop, demonstrated in front of the synagogue in Munchen for a pro-Israel protest and to denounce the attack of Hamas on 7 October 2023. They called for a stop to payments of money to the Gaza Strip, a change concerning Germany's Iran policy, and a ban on pro-Palestinian demonstrations in the city in the future.

organizers: Christian Group (Germany); Government of Germany (2021-); Jewish Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 12 October 2023, at the call of the Jewish community, around 300 people, including MPs, church representatives, and Social Affairs Minister (SPD), gathered at the Neuer Markt in Rostock to show solidarity with Israel after an attack by Hamas on 7 October 2023. Counter-protesters gathered to chant 'Free Palestine'.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; FDP: Free Democratic Party; Jewish Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany)
description: On 12 October 2023, around 250 people, including The Greens, SPD, FDP, CDU, and the Jewish community members, gathered at the Alten Markt in Lorrach to condemn the attack of Hamas in Israel on 7 October 2023. They wanted to show a strong sign of solidarity with Israel, but also with the Jewish people throughout the district.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); Jewish Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 11 October 2023, at the call of the Jewish community, around 300 people, including an MP (SPD), gathered not far from the town hall in Mainz for a solidarity rally for Israel.

organizers: CDU: Unitary Democratic Coalition; Government of Germany (2021-); Students (Germany)
description: On 11 October 2023, around 450 people, including the mayor (CDU) and students, gathered on the Universitatsplatz in Heidelberg to express their solidarity with the Israeli victims after an attack by the Hamas on 7 October 2023. They called for peace and unrestricted solidarity with Israel.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); Israeli Group (Germany); Jewish Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany)
description: On 11 October 2023, more than 200 people, including MPs (The Greens), the mayor (SPD), the Israeli Community, and the Jewish community, gathered at the Fischmarkt in Erfurt to show their solidarity with Israel after the attack by the Hamas on 7 October 2023. Demonstrators emphasized the Israel's right to exist and were also against the Iranian government.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; DIG: German-Israeli Society; Israeli Group (Germany); Jewish Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 10 October 2023, around 1,000 people, including leading politicians of the SPD and CDU, participated in a protest in Saarbrucken (Regionalverband Saarbrucken, Saarland) called for by the Synagogue congregation Saar and Deutsch-Israelische Gesellschaft Saar (German Israeli Society Saar) to express their solidarity with Israel and appeal to German politicians not to tolerate scenes like the one in Berlin on Saturday, when pro-Palestinian groups celebrated recent attacks by Hamas.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; DIG: German-Israeli Society; Government of Germany (2021-); Israeli Group (Germany); Jewish Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; Turkish Group (Germany)
description: On 10 October 2023, around 200 people, including several elected officials of the CDU and SPD, as well as representatives of the Jewish communities and the state chairman of the Turkish community, participated in a protest on Asmus-Bremer-Platz in Kiel (Schleswig-Holstein) organized by Junges Forum der Deutsch-Israelischen Gemeinschaft (Young Forum of the German-Israeli Society) to show solidarity with Israel. During a minute of silence, there were pro-Palestinian interjections by two men.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Christian Group (Germany); Government of Germany (2021-); Jewish Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 10 October 2023, people, including the mayor (SPD), members of Gesellschaft fur Christlich-Judische Zusammenarbeit, and politicians (SPD, CDU), gathered on Adenauerplatz in Monchengladbach to show solidarity with Israel and to call for peace.

organizers: Christian Group (Germany); Government of Germany (2021-); Jewish Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 9 October 2023, around 50 people, including the chairman of the Cologne Society for Christian-Jewish Cooperation and SPD district council member, joined a protest in front of St. Laurentius church in Bergisch Gladbach (Rheinisch-Bergischer Kreis, Nordrhein-Westfalen), called for by 'Verein zur Forderung der Stadtepartnerschaft Ganey Tikva-Bergisch Gladbach e.V.' (Association for the demand of the town twinning Ganey Tikva-Bergisch Gladbach e.V.) under the motto 'Solidarity with Israel' to condemn the attacks and violence against civilians by Hamas and show solidarity with Israel.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Christian Group (Germany); DIG: German-Israeli Society; Israeli Group (Germany); Jewish Group (Germany); The Greens (Germany)
description: On 9 October 2023, about 500 people, including state politicians of the Greens and CDU, Stuttgart's Rabbi Jehuda Pushkin as well as Church representatives, joined a protest on Marktplatz in Stuttgart (Baden-Wurttemberg) organized by 'Israelitische Religionsgemeinschaft Wurttemberg (IRGW)' and 'Deutsch-Israelische Gesellschaft (DIG)' and supported by 'Gesellschaft fur Christlich-Judische Zusammenarbeit' (Society for Christian-Jewish cooperation) and 'Scora-Schools opposing Racism and Antizionism' under the motto 'We stand with Israel' to show their solidarity with Israel, condemn the violence of Hamas and emphasize Israel's right to self-defense. Around 130 supporters of the Palestinians simultaneously joined a protest under the motto 'Stop the Israeli war against Palestinians - no second Nakba '48' organized by 'Palastinakomitee Stuttgart' at the Rotebuhlplatz - a few hundred meters from the Marktplatz - against Israel's politics, war and all kinds of violations of human rights. A group of protesters marched through Konigsstrasse carrying Palestine flags and loudly chanting pro-Palestine slogans to draw attention to the people in the Gaza Strip and their suffering.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; FDP: Free Democratic Party; Jewish Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany)
description: On 9 October 2023, around 100 people, including chairman of the newly founded association 'Judische Vergangenheit und Gegenwart Bad Honnef' (Jewish Past and Present in Bad Honnef), participated in a protest in Bad Honnef (Rhein-Sieg-Kreis, Nordrhein-Westfalen) called for by CDU, SPD, the Greens, FDP and 'Burgerblock' to set a sign against violence and antisemitism and show solidarity with Israel.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Israeli Group (Germany); Jewish Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany)
description: On 9 October 2023, around 1,500 people, including local politicians of the SPD, the CDU, and the Greens, as well as members of the Jewish community, joined a protest at Jungfernstieg in Hamburg - Hamburg-Mitte (Hamburg) organized by the German-Israeli Society to show solidarity with Israel and set a sign against antisemitism and violence. During the protest isolated disruptors shouted pro-Palestinian slogans.
