organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; FDP: Free Democratic Party; Government of Germany (2021-); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany)
description: On 25 February 2022, around 150 people, including a mayor, CDU, SPD, The Greens, FDP, demonstrated in Leverkusen against the Russian government and the invasion of Ukraine on 24 February 2022. Demonstrators called for economic sanctions on Russia and to welcome Ukrainian refugees.

organizers: SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany
description: On 24 February 2022, around 300 people, including SPD and CDU members, demonstrated in Saarbrucken in solidarity with Ukrainians and against the Russian invasion.

organizers: JL: Young Liberals; JU: Young Union; Jusos: Young Socialists in the SPD
description: On 23 February 2022, a small group of people, including JU, Jusos, and JL members, demonstrated in Bottrop in solidarity with Ukraine and against the war.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; FDP: Free Democratic Party; SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany); Ukrainian Group (Germany)
description: On 23 February 2022, around 200 people, including the Ukrainian community, demonstrated in Hamburg - Hamburg-Nord (Hamburg), in front of the Russian Consulate, at the call of several organizations (SPD, The Greens, CDU, FDP) against the war in Ukraine and the Russian government.

organizers: FDP: Free Democratic Party; Health Workers (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany)
description: On 22 February 2022, around 200 people, including health workers, gathered in Holzkirchen at the call of SPD, FDP, and The Greens to show solidarity with the people who are in the front lines of the coronavirus health crisis. They wanted to counter the events of people who are hostile to coronavirus-related measures.

organizers: SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Left (Germany)
description: On 22 February 2022, between 600 and 700 people, including SPD, The Left members, demonstrated in front of the Russian Embassy in Berlin - Mitte to call for peace in Ukraine, against the Russian government, and 'against the violation of Ukraine's sovereignty and territorial integrity, as well as aggression and escalation'.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; FDP: Free Democratic Party; SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany); Volt Europa
description: On 22 February 2022, around 250 people demonstrated in Frankfurt am Main at the call of several organizations (The Greens, Volt, CDU, SPD, FDP) against the war in Ukraine and the Russian government.

organizers: Alliance Against the Right; DGB: German Trade Union Confederation; Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany); The Left (Germany); Ver.di: United Services Union
description: On 19 February 2022, around 200 people, including SPD, The Greens, The Left, Ver.di, DGB, and Alliance Against the Right members, demonstrated in Heilbronn against racism and to commemorate the victims of a racist attack in Hanau which happened on 19 February 2020.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Government of Germany (2021-); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 19 February 2022, around 1,000 people, including CDU, SPD, and the mayor, demonstrated in Hanau to commemorate the racist attacks in Hanau, on 19 February 2020. Demonstrators were against racism and far-right movements. Demonstrators have criticized the slow investigation of the attack and demanded political consequences.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany)
description: On 19 February 2022, around 500 people, including the mayor, SPD, and The Greens members, demonstrated in Dusseldorf against racism and to commemorate the racist attack of Hanau (which happened on 19 February 2020). Demonstrators have criticized the slow investigation of the attack and demanded political consequences as well as more policies against racism.

organizers: Catholic Christian Group (Germany); IGM: Industrial Union of Metalworkers; Jusos: Young Socialists in the SPD; Labor Group (Germany); Protestant Christian Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany)
description: On 13 February 2022, around 230 people demonstrated in Heidelberg at the call of several organizations (SPD, Catholic and Protestant churches, The Greens, IGM, and Jusos) to demand more solidarity within the society during the coronavirus health crisis. They wanted to oppose conspiracy theories concerning coronavirus. Demonstrators were in favor of vaccination and formed a human chain.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Government of Germany (2021-)
description: On 9 February 2022, around 40 people, including the mayor and CDU members, demonstrated in Dusseldorf to counter the current national movement against coronavirus-related measures. People gathered in solidarity with those suffering from the coronavirus health crisis and called on Querdenken members to respect laws.

organizers: SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 7 February 2022, around 40 people demonstrated and gathered in Ganderkesee at the call of SPD against the Querdenken movement.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Labor Group (Germany); Teachers (Germany)
description: On 1 February 2022, around 60 people, including daycare workers, educators, CDU members, and parents, demonstrated in Mainz to express their concerns during the coronavirus health crisis and called for compulsory testing for the children's safety.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 29 January 2022, around 1,250 people, including SPD and CDU members, demonstrated in Cuxhaven in support of coronavirus-related measures.

organizers: PP: Pirate Party (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany)
description: On 25 January 2022, around 180 people demonstrated in Hof at the call of SPD, The Greens, and The Pirate Party, to demand solidarity, compliance with coronavirus-related measures, and coronavirus vaccination.

organizers: FFF: Fridays for Future; Health Workers (Germany); Jusos: Young Socialists in the SPD; Students (Germany); The Greens (Germany)
description: On 24 January 2022, around 230 people, including health workers, The Greens, FFF, and Jusos members, demonstrated in Fritzlar against the Querdenken movement, Nazis, and to call on people to get vaccinated against coronavirus. Demonstrators denounced links between Querdenken members and far-right movements (AFD). A handful of people gathered for a counter-demonstration against coronavirus-related measures.

organizers: SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 24 January 2022, around 120 people demonstrated and formed a human chain in Meckenheim at the call of SPD to demand more solidarity during the coronavirus health crisis and to show support to health workers. Between 80 and 100 people gathered for a counter-demonstration against coronavirus-related measures.

organizers: SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 24 January 2022, between 60 and 70 people demonstrated in Stralsund at the call of SPD to demand solidarity and cohesion during the coronavirus health crisis and to pay tribute to the victims of coronavirus.

organizers: FDP: Free Democratic Party; SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany); The Left (Germany)
description: On 24 January 2022, around 50 people, including SPD, The Greens, FDP, and The Left, demonstrated in Erkrath against people who are against coronavirus-related measures. They also paid tribute to the victims of the coronavirus health crisis.

organizers: SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 24 January 2022, around 40 people, including SPD members, gathered in front of the town hall in Kopenick in Berlin - Treptow-Kopenick (Berlin), to form a solidary human chain and protested against the spread of conspiracy ideologies in the coronavirus pandemic. Around 300 people inlcuding AFD, NPD, and the Third Path staged a counter-demonstration on the Luisenhain against the corona measures. Police dissolved both groups of protesters and arrested 87 of them.

organizers: Catholic Christian Group (Germany); Protestant Christian Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 22 January 2022, around 5,000 people, including SPD members, Catholics and Protestants, demonstrated and formed a human chain from Ulm to Neu-Ulm [coded to Neu-Ulm] against the movement protesting coronavirus-related measures and Querdenken members.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 22 January 2022, around 100 people, including SPD members and a mayor, demonstrated in Herne to denounce death threats received by a pastor by people who were against coronavirus-related measures. Protesters gathered in solidarity with the pastor.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; Students (Germany); Teachers (Germany); The Greens (Germany)
description: On 22 January 2022, between 350 and 400 people, including SPD, The Greens members, students, teachers, and local elected officials, demonstrated in Waldbrol against racism, homophobia, and discrimination. People were also against the AFD (far-right political party).

organizers: CSU: Christian Social Union in Bavaria; FDP: Free Democratic Party; SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany); The Left (Germany)
description: On 18 January 2022, in the evening, around 350 people gathered, at the call of CSU, SPD, The Greens, FDP and The Left, in Bad Kissingen to protest against unregistered 'walks' against coronavirus-related measures and to call for solidarity during the pandemic. The participants formed a human chain.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; FW: Free Voters; SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany)
description: On 17 January 2022, in the evening, about 600 people, including local Green party, SPD, FW and CDU affiliates, took part in a registered rally called 'We Are Democracy' in Schopfheim to protest against 'Monday Walks' against coronavirus-related measures and defend democracy and the rule of law.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 15 January 2022, in the evening, people, including the SPD Science Minister of Brandenburg, gathered for a vigil at the Brandenburg Gate in Potsdam to call on people to protect themselves by observing coronavirus-related measures and to commemorate the victims of the pandemic.

organizers: CSU: Christian Social Union in Bavaria; FW: Free Voters; Government of Germany (2021-); Health Workers (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany)
description: On 15 January 2022, late in the morning, around 300 people, including SPD, FW, CSU and Green party district politicians and elected officials, and the chief intensive care physician at the district hospital, gathered in Ebersberg to protest against 'Monday Walks' and support solidarity and coronavirus-related measures.

organizers: DGB: German Trade Union Confederation; Government of Germany (2021-); Labor Group (Germany); Protestant Christian Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany)
description: On 14 January 2022, in the afternoon, between 2,000 (according to the police) and 3,000 (organizers) people gathered for a vigil at the Opernplatz in Hannover to protest against conspiracy theories and Querdenken supporters amid a protest movement against coronavirus-related measures in the country. The vigil, which saw the participation of Lower Saxony's SPD Prime Minister, the SPD Hanover Region president and Green party representatives, had been organized by the Evangelical Lutheran Church of Hanover, the Hanover Circle of Friends and DGB.

organizers: CSU: Christian Social Union in Bavaria; FW: Free Voters; Government of Germany (2021-); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany)
description: On 13 January 2022, in the evening, people associated with the action alliance 'Hip is colorful', including The Greens-, SPD-, CSU- and FW-affiliates members of the city council as well as the city's mayor, set up an installation in front of the town hall in Hilpoltstein to protest against weekly protest 'walks' of vaccination skeptics and opponents to coronavirus-related measures in the city, and denounce the alleged infiltration of right-wing activists in the protest movement. One of such 'walks' was ongoing when they protested.

organizers: SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany); The Left (Germany)
description: On 13 January 2022, in the evening, more than 300 people gathered, at the call of the Alliance #Fuldahaltzusammen (supported by The Greens, SPD and The Left) in Uniplatz in Fulda to protest against 'Monday Walks' against coronavirus-related measures in the city.

organizers: Government of Germany (2021-); Protestant Christian Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 12 January 2022, about 80 people, including Protestant pastors and politicians such as the SPD deputy mayor, took part in an open air assembly in downtown Kirchweyhe to protest against the alleged infiltration of 'Monday Walks' against coronavirus-related measures by coronavirus deniers and violent actors.

organizers: SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 10 January 2022, between 6 pm and 7 pm, about 200 people, including a self-defined SPD affiliate, gathered for a 'walk' in Festplatz in downtown Roth (Roth, Bayern) to protest against coronavirus-related measures. Simultaneously, about 350 people, including the town's SPD-affiliated mayor, gathered under the motto 'Roth is colorful' to stage a counter-protest. Both groups remained separated by a police cordon.

organizers: SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 3 January 2022, people demonstrated in Potsdam at the call of SPD to celebrate the city's diversity, to take the streets from people demonstrating against coronavirus-related measures, and to show how to express one's opinion without violating laws.

organizers: Jusos: Young Socialists in the SPD; SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany); The Left (Germany)
description: On 20 December 2021, around 50 people, including The Left, Jusos, SPD, and The Greens members, demonstrated in Wildeshausen against the Querdenken movement and far-right movements including AFD and Die Basis.

organizers: SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany)
description: On 6 December 2021, between 20 and 30 people, including SPD and The Greens members, protested in Wildeshausen against the Querdenken movement and anti-Semitism as protesters both link them together.

organizers: BUND: German Federation for the Environment and Nature Conservation; CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; FFF: Fridays for Future; Government of Germany (2005-2021); NABU: Nature and Biodiversity Conservation Union; SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; Students (Germany); The Left (Germany)
description: On 4 December 2021, around 70 people, including mayors, members of CDU, SPD, NABU, BUND, The Left, Parents for Future, demonstrated in Solingen at the call of FFF for the preservation of gardens in the Bussche-Kessel-Weg district.

organizers: Catholic Christian Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany)
description: On 29 November 2021, more than 40 people, including members of SPD, The Greens, and Catholic believers, protested in Bergneustadt to call for coronavirus vaccination and social peace after tensions emerged following coronavirus-related measures. Protesters also raised awareness about climate change and poverty.

organizers: BUND: German Federation for the Environment and Nature Conservation; Campact; SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany)
description: On 2 November 2021, people, including members of BUND, Campact, SPD, and The Greens, protested in the government district in Berlin - Mitte to call on authorities to ban harmful pesticides, protect bees, and give more support to farmers.

organizers: SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; Students (Germany)
description: On 2 November 2021, around 530 people (according to the police), including SPD members and students, protested in Greifswald against the ongoing lecture of an AfD member at a university. Protesters were against far-right politics and what they called 'Nazi propaganda'.

organizers: Government of Germany (2005-2021); IGM: Industrial Union of Metalworkers; Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 29 October 2021, around 700 people, including employees of Opel, IGM members and an SPD elected official, protested in Kaiserslautern for the future of the Opel company and job security.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; IGM: Industrial Union of Metalworkers; Labor Group (Germany)
description: On 29 October 2021, around 8000 people, mostly Thyssenkrupp Steel employees, a CDU political member, protested in Duisburg at the call of IG Metall (IGM), for job security as well as sustainable ecological change in the chemical and steel industries.

organizers: GJ: Green Youth (Germany); Government of Germany (2005-2021); Jusos: Young Socialists in the SPD; The Greens (Germany); Women (Germany)
description: On 21 October 2021, around 30 people, including associations for women's rights, political activists (The Greens, Jusos, GJ), and elected officials, protested in front of the parliament in Stuttgart against delaying the reform of the state election law and for parity.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany
description: On 16 October 2021, around 300 people, including a CDU member, protested and took part in a vigil in Hamburg - Hamburg-Mitte (Hamburg), in the city center, against anti-Semitism and what they called 'Islamist anti-Semitism'. Protesters gathered in solidarity with a Jewish man who got beaten up at a vigil on 18 September 2021.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Government of Germany (2005-2021); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 11 October 2021, mayors from several cities, including SPD and CDU members, protested in Berlin - Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg in front of the Willy-Brandt-Haus to denounce growing debts and call for more financial aid.

organizers: Grannies Against the Right (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany); Women (Germany)
description: Around 10 October 2021 (as reported), around 180 people, including SPD, The Greens, and Grannies Against the Right members, protested in Schwarzenbek against the right and far right political parties. Protesters also denounced far right extremism.

organizers: Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 7 October 2021, around 90 gathered, at the call of the SPD and the Trade Union Federation, in Ludinghausen (Coesfeld, Nordrhein-Westfalen) to protest against a local publishing house's intention to become a non-profit foundation. The publishing house reportedly published books by well-known AFD politicians.

organizers: FDP: Free Democratic Party; FFF: Fridays for Future; SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; Students (Germany); The Greens (Germany); The Left (Germany)
description: On 24 September 2021, around 450 people, including activists (The Greens, The Left, SDP, FDP) protested in Weinheim at the call of FFF to urge the government to implement concrete measures to tackle climate change.

organizers: FFF: Fridays for Future; IB: Internationalist Alliance; MLPD: Marxist-Leninist Party of Germany; SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; Students (Germany)
description: On 24 September 2021, people, including MLPD, IB, and SPD members, protested in Recklinghausen at the call of FFF to urge the government to implement concrete measures to tackle climate change. MLPD members claimed to have been insulted by other protesters.

organizers: Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 20 September 2021, around 200 people, including employees of Ontex and SPD members, protested in Mayen against job cuts.

organizers: BUND: German Federation for the Environment and Nature Conservation; Farmers (Germany); FFF: Fridays for Future; Government of Germany (2005-2021); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; Students (Germany); The Greens (Germany); The Left (Germany)
description: On 19 September 2021, between 350 (according to the police) and 1000 people, including farmers, elected officials, cyclists, political members (The Greens, SPD, The Left), FFF, and BUND activists, protested from Gottenheim to Breisach am Rhein [coded to Breisach am Rhein] against the expansion of a road.

organizers: Grannies Against the Right (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany); The Left (Germany); Women (Germany)
description: On 19 September 2021, more than 150 people, including Grannies Against the Right members and political members (The Left, The Greens, SPD), protested in Friedrichshafen against an ongoing AfD rally. Protesters called for unity for tolerance and diversity.

organizers: DGB: German Trade Union Confederation; Jusos: Young Socialists in the SPD; Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany); The Left (Germany)
description: On 15 September 2021, around 200 people protested Biberach at the call of organizations (Jusos, The Left, The Greens, DGB, SPD) against an ongoing AfD rally and far right political parties.

organizers: Health Workers (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 14 September 2021, people, in around 500 vehicles, mostly health aides and an SPD member, protested and blocked a parliament in Hannover to call for better pay. Protesters denounced how they are treated poorly by care insurance companies.

organizers: Government of Germany (2005-2021); PARTEI: The Party; SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany)
description: On 3 September 2021, around 100 people, including elected officials and members of political parties (The Greens, SPD, Die Partei), protested in Moosburg against the presence of a rally of the political party AfD. Protesters wanted to celebrate the multicultural aspect of the city and denounce discrimination.

organizers: GJ: Green Youth (Germany); Jusos: Young Socialists in the SPD; Left Youth Solid
description: On 29 August 2021, activists from the GJ, Left Youth Solid and Jusos protested in Aalen with a vigil to draw attention to the situation in Afghanistan after the return of the Taliban.

organizers: Jusos: Young Socialists in the SPD
description: On 21 August 2021, around 20 people protested in Holzkirchen at the call of the Jusos for affordable housing.

organizers: SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 21 August 2021, animal rights activists protested in Hannover at the call of the SPD against industrial farming.

organizers: SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Left (Germany)
description: On 16 August 2021, around 100 people, including a SPD and a The Left politician, protested in Halle (Saale) in solidarity with a climate camp and against the far right and fascism. The protest was triggered by a member of the far right cutting the rope of one of the tents of the climate camp and insulting the climate camp activists.

organizers: Jewish Group (Germany); JL: Young Liberals; JU: Young Union; Jusos: Young Socialists in the SPD; Students (Germany)
description: On 1 August 2021, around 80 people protested in Tubingen against anti-Semitism. The protest was organized by the Jewish Student Union, the Jusos, the Young Union, and the Young Liberals.

organizers: Health Workers (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Left (Germany)
description: On 30 July 2021, around 30 people protested in Eichstatt for the preservation of the local hospital. The protest was organized by the SPD and attended by hospital workers and The Left.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany); The Left (Germany)
description: On 25 July 2021, people staged a vigil in Dorsten to protest against the daubing of a 'Respect' art work by unknow perpetrators. The vigil was attended by local politicians of the CDU, SPD, The Greens, and The Left.

organizers: FFF: Fridays for Future; Students (Germany); The Greens (Germany); Grannies Against the Right (Germany); Women (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; BUND: German Federation for the Environment and Nature Conservation
description: On 23 July 2021, around 250 people, among them Fridays for Future, BUND, The Greens, SPD, and Grannies Against the Right activists, protested in Munchen outside the State Chancellery for more climate action.

organizers: BLM: Black Lives Matter; SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Left (Germany)
description: On 17 July 2021, around 60 people, including The Left and SPD politicians, gathered for a BLM protest against racism in Heidelberg. The protest was part of a 'Anti-Racism Weekend'.

organizers: Government of Germany (2005-2021); Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 1 July 2021, up to 600 employees of Premium Aerotec protested at the call of SPD politicians with a march to the town hall in Varel against restructuring plans. The protest was attended by the State Minister for Environment.

organizers: Health Workers (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 15 June 2021, around 20 health workers protested in Dachau against the privatization of hospitals and for the rights of health workers. An SPD politician attended the protest to show solidarity.

organizers: Indivisible; SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 29 May 2021, around 2,000 people protested in Halle (Saale) against right-wing 'extremism', the AfD, anti-Semitism and racism ahead of state elections. The protest was organized by Indivisible and attended by a SPD politician.

organizers: Government of Germany (2005-2021); CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; Jewish Group (Germany)
description: On 21 May 2021, people, including the mayor, and CDU and SPD politicians, protested in Saarbrucken in solidarity with Israel and against anti-Semitism amid tensions in the Middle East between Israel and Palestine. The protest was organized by the DIG and the local synagogue community.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; FDP: Free Democratic Party; Government of Germany (2005-2021); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 20 May 2021, people protested at the Brandenburger Tor in Berlin - Mitte (Berlin) in solidarity with Israel amid escalating tensions in the Middle East between Israel and Palestine. The protest was attended by the Minister for Finance (SPD), the Minister for Justice (SPD), the head of the FDP, the Minister for Labour Affairs (SPD), the Health Minister (CDU), and the city's mayor.

organizers: CSU: Christian Social Union in Bavaria; Health Workers (Germany); Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Left (Germany); Ver.di: United Services Union
description: On 14 May 2021, around 200 people, including health workers and a The Left, a SPD, and a CSU representative, protested in Wolfratshausen for the preservation of the local hospital and against a possible privatization of the hospital.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; IGM: Industrial Union of Metalworkers; Labor Group (Germany); The Greens (Germany)
description: On 14 May 2021, around 1,000 employees of ZF protested in Diepholz against job cuts. The protest, which also included a car rally, was organized by the IGM and supported by a The Greens and a CDU parliamentarian.

organizers: FDP: Free Democratic Party; IGM: Industrial Union of Metalworkers; Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 10 May 2021, employees of the insolvent Nobiskrug shipyard protested in Rendsburg for the preservation of the shipyard on the occasion of the 12th Maritime Conference. The protest was organized by the IGM and attended by a SPD politician.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; DGB: German Trade Union Confederation; Government of Germany (2005-2021); Labor Group (Germany)
description: On 1 May 2021, around 500 people gathered for a 'drive-in cinema' protest with their cars in Dusseldorf for a May Day (Labor Day) protest. The motto of the protest, organized by the DGB and attended by the CDU politician and North Rhine-Westphalian Minister President Armin Laschet, was 'Solidarity is the Future'. Protesters demanded fair handling of coronavirus consequences.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; DGB: German Trade Union Confederation; Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany)
description: On 1 May 2021, around 100 people gathered for a protest in Barnstorf on the occasion of May Day (Labor Day) to demand education equality, flexible working hours and to protest against an increasing gap between 'the poor and the rich'. The protest was organized by the DGB and attended by CDU, SPD, and The Greens politicians.

organizers: DGB: German Trade Union Confederation; GEW: German Education Union; Government of Germany (2005-2021); Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; Teachers (Germany); The Greens (Germany); The Left (Germany)
description: On 1 May 2021, around 150 people gathered for a protest in Wurzburg on the occasion of May Day (Labor Day). The motto of the protest, organized by the DGB, was 'Solidarity is the Future'. Protesters, among them representatives of the GEW, SPD, Left, Greens, and the mayor, demanded a fair distribution of costs resulting from the coronavirus pandemic.

organizers: DGB: German Trade Union Confederation; Government of Germany (2005-2021); Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany)
description: On 1 May 2021, around 100 people gathered for a protest in Potsdam on the occasion of May Day (Labor Day) for better working conditions in particular in the wake of the coronavirus pandemic. The Federal Minister for Financial Affairs and SPD politician Olaf Scholz and the Greens politician Annalena Baerbock spoke at the protest, organized by the DGB.

organizers: DGB: German Trade Union Confederation; Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; Ver.di: United Services Union
description: On 1 May 2021, around 100 people, including a SPD politician and Ver.di representatives, protested in Bad Tolz in front of the Asklepios hospital with the slogan 'Health Before Profits' against the privatization of the health sector and the dismissal of some hospital workers by the Asklepios hospital. The protest was organized either by DGB or the Ver.di.

organizers: Labor Group (Germany); MLPD: Marxist-Leninist Party of Germany; SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Left (Germany); Ver.di: United Services Union
description: On 1 May 2021, more than 40 people, among them Ver.di, MLPD, The Left and SPD representatives, protested in Herne on the occasion of May Day (Labor Day). The exact reason for the protest was not reported.

organizers: IB: Internationalist Alliance; SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 1 May 2021, around 150 to 200 people, including one SPD member, protested in Oberhausen on the occasion of May Day (Labor Day). The protest was organized by the IB. The exact reason for the protest was not reported.

organizers: SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Left (Germany)
description: On 1 May 2021, people gathered for a protest in Juterbog on the occasion of May Day (Labor Day). The exact reason for the protest, organized by The Left and SPD, was not clear.

organizers: SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; Women (Germany)
description: On 29 April 2021, politicians, including from the SPD, protested in Hannover against violence against women and Turkey's exit from the Istanbul Convention. The politicians put red shoes on the stairs of the state parliament symbolizing missing, violated, raped and murdered women.

organizers: Government of Germany (2005-2021); Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 26 April 2021, workers in the metal and electrical industry protested in Berlin - Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg (Berlin), gathering on the Oberbaum Bridge, for equal working conditions in East and West Germany. The SPD mayor of the city attended the protest.

organizers: SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany)
description: On 17 April 2021, around 350 people protested in Volkmarsen against a Young Alternative (youth party of the Alternative for Germany) party congress. The protest was organized by SPD and The Greens.

organizers: FDP: Free Democratic Party; FW: Free Voters; SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 21 March 2021, around 200 to 500 people, among them a SPD, FW and FDP politician, protested in Munchen against the coronavirus protection measures.

organizers: The Left (Germany); The Greens (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; Alliance Against the Right
description: On 13 March 2021, around 100 to 200 people protested in Paaren im Glien against an Alternative for Germany party conference. The protest was organized by, amongst others, the Alliance Against the Right and attended by SPD, The Left and The Greens politicians.

organizers: DGB: German Trade Union Confederation; IGM: Industrial Union of Metalworkers; Labor Group (Germany); MLPD: Marxist-Leninist Party of Germany; SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Left (Germany)
description: Around 9 March 2021 (as reported), around 300 employees of Siemens Gorlitz staged a warning strike to protest for higher wages amidst collective wage negotiations. The protest was organized by the IGM and supported by the DGB, SPD, The Left and the MLPD.

organizers: CSU: Christian Social Union in Bavaria; Government of Germany (2005-2021); Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany
description: On 1 March 2021, caterers and hoteliers protested in Ingolstadt for the reopening of their restaurants and hotels, which are closed due to the coronavirus pandemic. The mayor of the city, a CSU and a SPD politician supported the protest.

organizers: CDU: Christian Democratic Union of Germany; Labor Group (Germany); SPD: Social Democratic Party of Germany; The Greens (Germany); The Left (Germany)
description: On 23 January 2021, employees of Durstexpress protested in Leipzig against job cuts. The protest was attended and supported by politicians of the SPD, CDU, The Left and The Greens.

organizers: ADFC: German Bicycle Club; BUND: German Federation for the Environment and Nature Conservation; Jusos: Young Socialists in the SPD; NABU: Nature and Biodiversity Conservation Union; The Greens (Germany)
